subject: Move threshold interfaces to common function
commitMessage:
Move threshold interfaces to common function

Threshold Hardshutdown and Softshutdown interfaces needs to be
created for sensors. Therefore, created a common function
called getInterface() to access all the threshold
interfaces from all the sensors source file and removed
hasCriticalInterface(), hasWarningInterface() functions.

Moreover, threshold interfaces from all the sensor constructor has
been refactored to avoid duplicating functions.

TESTED: Tested on Facebook YosemiteV2 hardware. Verified that the
Warning and Critical interfaces are created and displaying in
dbus objects.

Signed-off-by: Jayashree Dhanapal <jayashree-d@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I9c7d049c7d4445d7199bf63d8e729838990880e9

enum classes should be taken by value, not reference.
Considering there are only 4 levels in the newest one, can this just be a std::array< std::shared_ptr<sdbusplus::asio::dbus_interface>, 4>

operator[] creates an entry if one doesn't exist, which is almost certainly not what you intended here.  If this moves into an array, this just becomes an index, even if it doesn't, this should be a using find.
Every use of hasInterface method is used this way, so should this just be done within the hasInterfaceMethod method?
again, operator[] creates an entry if it doesn't exist.  Please don't do that.
Should this be "get".  Has implies that it exists.
Considering that this method can fail, you don't check for this error case anywhere in your code.  Please handle your errors properly.
one minor thing, then this looks good to me
I suspect this should be a reference to avoid making a shared_ptr copy (which admittedly is inexpensive, but we should avoid nonstheless)

In the above if condition, I have checked the threshold level and direction for each sensor in findOrder() function. This function will verify whether the level is present in the thresProp array. If the level is not present, it will continue and read next threshold. So the range check will be verified in that function.

This is two lines of code.  Please just inline it where it's needed to make clear that that this has been range checked.

Alternatively, if you want this to be its own function, you could make it interact with thresholdInterfaces directly, and return std::shared_ptr<sdbusplus::asio::dbus_interface> or nullptr if it can't be found.  Either way is fine with me, with a minor preference for the second, but as written, it's still non-obvious that your operator[] calls have been range checked.
That's exactly what I was looking for.  Thank you.
